values.description:
I found the DRCVehiclePlugin API a bit ambiguous with regard to steering. For example, the method SetSteeringState is not obviously about the steered wheels. I've attempted to make the methods self-describing by referring to the steering wheel as "handwheel" and references to the tire steering as "steered wheels".

I've also added parameters for the radius of each wheel, the front and rear track widths and the wheelbase. These parameters are derived from the collision objects associated with joint names passed from the sdf to the plugin code (front_left_joint, front_right_joint, back_left_joint, back_right_joint). I assume that the the wheel link is the child of the joint. I also assume that each wheel has only one collision object attached. These assumptions work for the low_poly_golf_cart model, but are sensitive to the formulation of the sdf.

Using the wheelbase and track width parameters, I added Ackermann steering to the model, though I still need to explain the equations I used.

I also adjusted the pose math used to computed the vehicle geometry parameters.

Then I merged with gerkey_default to get the fixed header files.
values.title: Several changes to DRCVehicle plugin

summary.raw:
I found the DRCVehiclePlugin API a bit ambiguous with regard to steering. For example, the method SetSteeringState is not obviously about the steered wheels. I've attempted to make the methods self-describing by referring to the steering wheel as "handwheel" and references to the tire steering as "steered wheels".

I've also added parameters for the radius of each wheel, the front and rear track widths and the wheelbase. These parameters are derived from the collision objects associated with joint names passed from the sdf to the plugin code (front_left_joint, front_right_joint, back_left_joint, back_right_joint). I assume that the the wheel link is the child of the joint. I also assume that each wheel has only one collision object attached. These assumptions work for the low_poly_golf_cart model, but are sensitive to the formulation of the sdf.

Using the wheelbase and track width parameters, I added Ackermann steering to the model, though I still need to explain the equations I used.

I also adjusted the pose math used to computed the vehicle geometry parameters.

Then I merged with gerkey_default to get the fixed header files.
summary.html:
I found the DRCVehiclePlugin API a bit ambiguous with regard to steering. For example, the method SetSteeringState is not obviously about the steered wheels. I've attempted to make the methods self-describing by referring to the steering wheel as "handwheel" and references to the tire steering as "steered wheels".

I've also added parameters for the radius of each wheel, the front and rear track widths and the wheelbase. These parameters are derived from the collision objects associated with joint names passed from the sdf to the plugin code (front_left_joint, front_right_joint, back_left_joint, back_right_joint). I assume that the the wheel link is the child of the joint. I also assume that each wheel has only one collision object attached. These assumptions work for the low_poly_golf_cart model, but are sensitive to the formulation of the sdf.

Using the wheelbase and track width parameters, I added Ackermann steering to the model, though I still need to explain the equations I used.

I also adjusted the pose math used to computed the vehicle geometry parameters.

Then I merged with gerkey_default to get the fixed header files.

values.description:
I've moved the DRCVehiclePlugin from plugins to plugins/ros and added several ROS topics for controlling the vehicle.

To listen to the current actuator states:
/hand_wheel/state
/gas_pedal/state
/brake_pedal/state

To set an actuator command:
/hand_wheel/cmd
/gas_pedal/cmd
/brake_pedal/cmd

The state messages are currently broadcast at 1 Hz. The public method DRCVehiclePlugin::SetPublishRate can change the broadcast rate (similar to gazebo::Sensor::SetUpdateRate), but it is not yet connected to anything.
values.title: Connect DRCVehiclePlugin to ROS

summary.raw:
I've moved the DRCVehiclePlugin from plugins to plugins/ros and added several ROS topics for controlling the vehicle.

To listen to the current actuator states:

To set an actuator command:

The state messages are currently broadcast at 1 Hz. The public method DRCVehiclePlugin::SetPublishRate can change the broadcast rate (similar to gazebo::Sensor::SetUpdateRate), but it is not yet connected to anything.
summary.html:
I've moved the DRCVehiclePlugin from plugins to plugins/ros and added several ROS topics for controlling the vehicle.

To listen to the current actuator states: /hand_wheel/state /gas_pedal/state /brake_pedal/state

To set an actuator command: /hand_wheel/cmd /gas_pedal/cmd /brake_pedal/cmd

The state messages are currently broadcast at 1 Hz. The public method DRCVehiclePlugin::SetPublishRate can change the broadcast rate (similar to gazebo::Sensor::SetUpdateRate), but it is not yet connected to anything.

values.description: For the golf cart, the angle of the handwheel is coupled to the angle of the front wheels through the DRCVehiclePlugin, but the directions are reversed. Turning the handwheel to the left causes the front wheels to point the right and vice versa. This pull request reverses the direction of the handwheel axis in the golf cart model so that the steering directions match.
values.title: Fix golf cart steering

summary.raw: For the golf cart, the angle of the handwheel is coupled to the angle of the front wheels through the DRCVehiclePlugin, but the directions are reversed. Turning the handwheel to the left causes the front wheels to point the right and vice versa.
